message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SE

This paper discusses the challenges and solutions of using blockchain technology in the context of the Internet of Things (IoT). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), which deals with security and privacy issues in computer systems. The paper also discusses the use of blockchain in peer-to-peer networks, which falls under the category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval), as it involves the retrieval and sharing of information. Additionally, the paper discusses the decentralized topology of IoT, which falls under the category of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The proposed architecture also involves coordination with cloud storages, which falls under the category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Finally, the paper proposes a new architecture for IoT, which involves the design and implementation of a system, falling under the category of cs.SE (Software Engineering).
